title: POCO M2 Pro (Two Shades of Black, 64 GB)  (4 GB RAM)

product_specification.In The Box: Handset, Power Adaptor, USB Type C Data Cable, Phone Cover, SIM Ejector Tool, User Guide
product_specification.Sound Enhancements: Single (Bottom Opening) Speaker with Smart PA
product_specification.Operating Frequency: 2G Bands: 2/3/5/8, 3G Bands: 1/2/5/8, 4G FDD Bands: 1/3/5/8, 4G TDD Bands: 40/41
product_specification.Primary Camera Features: 48MP (Wide) + 8MP (Ultra Wide) + 5MP (Macro) + 2MP (Depth) Rear Camera Setup, 48MP Ultra Clear Mode, Night Mode, AI Scene Detection, Ultra Wide Angle, Pro Mode, Portrait Mode, Panorama Mode, Slow Motion Capture, Rear Camera Frame Rate: 4K at 30 fps, 1080p at 60 fps
product_specification.Secondary Camera Features: 16MP Front Camera, Night Mode, Front HDR, Short Video, Front Camera Frame Rate: 1080P/720P at 30 fps
product_specification.Sensors: Proximity Sensor, Gyroscope, Accelerometer, Electronic Compass
product_specification.Other Features: 33 W Fast Charger, Side Fingerprint Scanner, Face Unlock, Dual App Support, Notification Light, Screen Mirror/Cast
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year for Handset, 6 Months for Accessories

product_description.Powerful to the Core: Thanks to its Qualcomm Snapdragon 720G processor, Qualcomm Adreno 618 GPU, and up to 4 GB of RAM, this smartphone is armed to its teeth to offer you breezy-smooth smartphone performance.
product_description.Monstrous Battery: The POCO M2 Pro boasts a 5000-mAh battery, which, when combined with its 33 W fast charging, sees to it that you can use the phone for hours on end without having to charge it frequently. To give you a fair idea about how powerful this phone’s battery is, you enjoy up to 20.5 days of standby time, about 210 hours of playback time, or up to 29 hours of VoLTE calling on a single full charge.
product_description.Rear Camera That Blows Minds: Its 48-megapixel quad-camera system, which includes a 119-degree, 8-megapixel ultra-wide camera and a 5-megapixel macro camera, among others, and Pro-Colour Mode help you capture portraits, landscapes, architecture, and various other things, delivering them in the form of beautiful photographs.
product_description.In-screen Selfie Camera: This smartphone from POCO features a 16-megapixel in-screen selfie camera with Night Mode, which sees to it that your selfies are amazing irrespective of whether you take them during the day or night.
product_description.Crystal-clear Display: This handset packs a 16.9-centimetre (6.67) FHD+ full screen display with an aspect ratio of 20:9 that paves the way for stunning visuals. On top of that, its refresh rate of 60 Hz ensures that any game you play on this smartphone is highly immersive. Also, Triple Corning Gorilla Glass 5 keeps this smartphone’s screen protected from accidental drops and scratches.
product_description.Fingerprint Sensor with Z-Shocker Haptic: It comes with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor that is more responsive than its predecessors. In addition, Z-Shocker Haptics offer a seamless touch experience, which makes this handset a treat to use.
product_description.P2i Splash-proof Coating: The POCO M2 Pro features the P2i coating to ensure that water splashes don’t seep through and prevent this smartphone from performing as well as it does.

Overview: Great product with probably best specs at this price point. Decent camera, great looks, great battery and charging.

Design:Looks great and classy due to gorilla glass at back. camera bump is slightly bigger but this issue can fixed by using cover. Phone is slightly bigger.

Display:It has 6.67inch ips lcs display. Viewing angles are good has Decent brightness. There is screen bleeding around camera cutout and edges of display but not a big deal every lcd djisplay has screen bleeding and can be solved by using dark mode.

Camera:Forget about megapixels it has Decent camera. back camera is good video quality is also good u can record video in 4k. macro camera is great.
But front camera is not that great I don't know why it makes faces yellowish. hope it will be resolved in future updates.

Battery and charging: Best in this price segment can be used for 2 days in normal usage. It takes 1:20-25 min to full charge,above 58%in 30 min,85%in 1 hour. For me it's battery and charger was deal breaker.

Performance:it has Snapdragon's 720g. Great performance. But I saw some lags in the UI which can be solved in future updates. I didn't played pubg but I played some games no heating issue at all.

Speaker: nice speaker. Vocals are clear and has Decent loudness

Final verdict: I think it's best phone in this price point. U can opt this over realme 6 only realme 6's camera is better than this.

Deducted one star due to its privacy issues. Clean master is still there.

Nice phone.. my main purpose to buy this phone was to study and battery backup is really excellent and camera is good and display is very comfortable for my eyes..

Display: im the one who used Samsung s7 sAmoled 551ppi QHD+ display for 3 yrs. So this kinda a let down for me. Contrast level is good & colors are well calibrated but still u can feel a downgrade if u have used a AMOLED panel before. & 90hz would have been greatest. I think faster refresh rate boomed amoled growth in India, every phone around 15k-20k was coming with amoled & then high refresh rate arrived with oneplus & all company started giving lcd with 90/120hz I will still prefer sAmoled over 90hz/120hz icd
Camara: use Gcam.. Default camara is very feature proof. I'm used to pro mode for even video & that's a reason why I peaked this phone over realme 6i. & I'm into filmmaking so hopefully I will try provideo 4k 30 log quite often. But I would loved to see EIS in 4k & 1080p 60fps to add slowmo & still doesn't have to worry about my non-log & Log footage not looking similar in post production in log format bcoz as u choose log it automatically switches to 4k 30.
What I want in update is 2x portrait option in portrait mode like xiaomi did with redmi note 5 pro. & 24fps in video bcoz why not iPhone is doing that for years so it's time to give it in default app.
Performance: great but I want smooth + extrme in 4gb ram version though I haven't noticed any lag in smooth+ultra
Battery: killer battery life easily 1 day phone. Well optimized
Software: I want miui 12 in future update(upcoming weeks) & with that miui 12 I want I single bloatware removed.
On hand feel: bulky & too tall. I think 6.2 should be the largest any phone can go. 5.8 in pixel & iPhone is perfect size
So great phone for the price

I have been using this phone for the last 3 days... If you are looking for a massive battery phone with fast charging then go for it... Specifically it's charging animation is really impressive... Display is good... Camera quality is ok type but there are a lot of options like raw photos , log videos etc.... Processor is good so one won't face any problem in day to day life usage... There is also no heating issue during charging....I don't do heavy gaming so I have no idea about gaming on this device.... but according to it's price range it is best value for money for regular usage... Also initially all banned Chinese apps are present but an ota update has given by poco to fix it....During this 3 days usage i haven't find a single add which is really impressive... Sound quality also good and audio output through Bluetooth device or ear phones is good.... Weight distribution is nice and it's not heavy although it has a big massive battery... So finally in this price range it's a value for money device .

Yeah, I definately liked the phone...
1. BATTERY :- It's has got amazing battery which easily gives me more than 8 hours of SOT on moderate usage. It may drop it around 6 hours on heavy usage.
2. CHARGING:- But disappointed with the charging speed. It is very unpredictable. Sometimes it charges like zap and sometimes it's takes more than usual. And please don't use phone while charging it. It's charging speed drops significantly. It feels like you are charging it with 10w of power.
3. CAMERAS:- And talking about cameras... They are great... Definately one of the best in the segment and I loved the macro camera. But the burst mode don't work though there is a feature. That's disappointing.
4. SOFTWARE EXPERIENCE:- I regret to say this but it's the worst smartphone experience with MIUI. It's barely optimised. The dark mode don't work properly... even on some system applications. Sometimes framework stops working which is very frustrating. The alignment of some icons on the status bar in landscape mode also is off. And I shifted from a vivo device and I feel like Funtouch OS was way better.
5. PERFORMANCE:- I never had any issues while playing heavy games @60 fps also. But sometimes some apps crashes which may be due to software, like whatsapp hangs sometimes. No complaints from performance though.
6. DISPLAY:- No complaints but it would have been better if the brightest was more. But still enjoys the multimedia on the big 6.67 inchs screen and nice and loud speakers.
CONCLUSION:-
Apart from software I don't have any major problems from this device and I think software will improve with time with the coming of MIUI 12 (Atleast I hope so🤞🏻)
So you should definitely consider this device.
I AM A GENUINE BUYER AND JUST TELLING YOU THE TRUTH WHICH I FACED.
PLEASE CONSIDER THE ABOVE POINTS WHILE PURCHASE.

Best phone in this price range.


#Best battery life

If you are into watching & streaming movies , browsing ,social media etc this phone is gona last a full day with avg screen on time of 9+ hours.
8% drop in battery for watching a 2 hr movie on mx player with 4% brightness.
9% drop in battery while browsing for 1 hour.
Can charge the mobile 0 - 100% in about 80minutes.
0 - 50 takes only 30 minutes.

#Camera

Rear Camera is above average , not the greatest. Have 4k video recording options, Stabilization is only for 1080p videos. Videos are saved in mp4 format with H.265 codec option.

Front camera is average, in good lighting conditions it's good.

#Other

*Display & brightness is way too good. Can use it under sunny weather, no reflection. Max 575 nits brightness & have HDR10 Support.
*Build quality is good. Feels solid & not slippery on hands.
Corning Gorilla Glass 5 on both sides & also on the camera module.
*Call quality & Signal strength - both wifi & cellular is good. No drops.
*App loading is faster & no app reloading problem when using multiple apps & multiple tabs on Chrome or opera. U.i is good , lots of themes & customisation options, doesn't show any mi ads or other spammy notification. You can disable Google ad preference at beginning of the setup.

Cons

Feels heavy at first. Not a big cons. You will get used to it after a while.
Lots of unwanted/bloatware apps are pre installed. Can uninstall most of them.
Feels slightly hot even if the temp was 40°c , bcs of the glass back i think. This happens only when using outdoor under sunny conditions with full brightness.
Front camera is average, photos taken at night or under average lighting conditions has lots of grains.

Sharing my review after almost 1month of usage, I had buyed 4gb ram variant have come across every aspect of the Phone and here are some pros and cons of the handset :-
Pros:-
1)Camera performs very well in normal day light conditions and 48 mp sensor in fine at this budget.
2)My experience with snapdragon 720g was great I have not experienced any lag even in high graphic settings in asphalt 8 and 9
3)Glass back finishing really gives it a great look (colour:-Two shades of Black)
4)Phone doesn't heat much as compared to mediatek processor phones.
5)The 6.67 inch display gives good experience while gaming and thanks to gorilla glass 5.
Cons:-

2) Night mode needs improvement.

I hope this review will be helpful 🤗

Purchased this phone during the Diwali sale for 11k and I must say, at that price this phones a killer. Will divide the review between pros & cons

Pros :

1. Gorilla glass at front & back give it a super premium look & feel. Frame is plastic and the phone feels really good to hold.

2. Charging speed & battery life r outstanding. The SD 720G is a super Power efficient processor. The 5000 mah battery can easily last for 1.5 to 2 days and the 33 watt charger is splendid. Can charge the phone from 0 to 100% in 70 mins.

3. Performance is good. The SD 720G is a capable processor and gets daily job done with ease. I haven't faced any heating issues either.

4. Camera is very good during the day. Pics come out with good detail. However the pics r a bit saturated which however look good to the eyes.

5. Display is an IPS panel with Full HD resolution. The display quality is really good for an IPS panel.

6. Has an IR Blaster which can be used as a remote control.

Cons:

1. The MIUI is not stable and is not makin good use of the very capable SD 720G processor. MIUI needs a lot of improvement and stability.

One of the highest spec phones currently in the under 15000 budget (for the 4 GB RAM variant). The 4GB RAM is enough for heavy games but more importantly the processor + GPU is able to keep up and deliver quality graphics even for heavy games. I didn't face any abnormal hearing issues either.

The camera is decent. I know there may be better cameras out there but it's already very good for the price range. The display only has the normal 60 Hz refresh rate but viewing angles are good. The max brightness is quite high so the screen is visible even under direct sunlight. The low brightness is low enough to comfortably see in the dark.

The back is glass so you'll always want to use the case with it. The case provided in the box is okay and the phone is comfortable to hold even with the case on. However if you often drop your phone then get one with a plastic back.

MIUI is loved by some and hated by others. Get the phone if you are okay with MIUI or are ready with the tools and knowledge to replace it.

It's been 6 Months using this POCO M2 Pro.
Let's start this review
1. Powerful Processor : POCO M2 Pro has Qualcomm 720G Processor in it with Qualcomm Adreno 618 GPU which is great combination and the price of this phone makes it extraordinary.
2. Strong Battery : It has 5000mah battery, battery backup it good as well. The special thing is it has 33W charging support which you can see it takes approximately an hour to full charge which is great in this price range and this is more than expectation.
3. Normal Camera : I'm not the one who loves to take pictures and i think i can't provide review about it because i don't actually pay attention to it besides clicking photos of documents. but overall it is capable of fulfilling basic needs related to camera.
4. Mind-blowing Display : POCO M2 Pro comes with 6.67inch FHD+ display which is kind of great having mobile with big screen. and yes the best part is it comes with covering of Gorila Glass 5 which is latest in market and there were many times my phone was dropped by mistake and that doesn't made any difference it was same as before.

I think this is enough to convince you to purchase this awesome product, personally I've been using this phone from 6 months and it was great experience using it. I'm a happy customer of POCO.

Overall in terms of specs provided, it's simply a brilliant phone, but specs don't tell the entire story.

Pros:
-Really good camera for the price no complaints there. Camera: (4.5/5)
-The processor is best in segment, so u can expected great performance but...(see rest in cons)
Performance: 4.25/5
-Charging speed is pretty good with 33W charger, but certainly realme chargers are faster.
-Display (4/5): not an amoled but a pretty good IPS display no complaints, but certainly u can get way better display on a realme 8/ redmi note 10 with amoled displays.
-Build quality and design(4.5/5): is pretty good as it is the only phone in it's price to come with a glass back. However don't know about its durability as certain videos have shown it can easily break!!

Cons:
-Software experience is a major con which certainly detoriates day to day performance. While the UI looks good with lots of animations, but it makes it slightly slower as well. However, the main problem is the occasional hangs and stutters which makes u feel u r using a cheaper/older phone, and completely makes u forget it has a SD720G!
-The software also has quite a few bugs which once again heavily affects your day to day usage.
-Battery life could have been better as it has detoriated after a recent software update.

My Worst decision ever 🥲

List of Bugs and Issues:

Animation bugs:
1. No closing animation in Poco launcher since the beginning.
2. App Opening animation and other few swiping animations in the home screen are laggy in Poco launcher compare to the smooth miui system launcher.
3. No unlocking and locking animation like miui system launcher. Instead while unlocking it's suddenly going to the home screen and while locking it suddenly goes black with no animation and smoothness there.

Full-screen navigation bugs:
4. In the recent menu, a Whiteline (in light mode) or Blackline (in dark mode) appears in each application bottom while using the navigation pill or navigation button.
5. Navigation pill isn't properly adopting colour, sometimes navigation pill background colour becomes white or black instead of being transparent in home screen ( Poco launcher ).
6. Navigation pill isn't properly optimized for switching between apps. Sometimes swiping left or right instead of switching between apps, it got stuck and then simply goes to the home screen ( Poco launcher ).
7. Full-screen navigation gestures don't support other third-party launchers.

Widgets Issues:
6. Poco launcher aren't properly optimized for widgets, Some third-party widgets just got crop from sides like new Spotify and Mi notes widgets.

Missing features from MIUI system laucher:
1. Global icon animations are missing.
2. Arrange items in the recent menu option is missing.
3. Doesn't have float window gesture and float window option in the recent menu.
4. There is no option to remove the app drawer.

Some other issues:
7. Frame drop issues in Poco launcher while scrolling in the app drawer, swiping in home screen, opening notification center, and also in switching between apps through navigation pills.
8. Poco devices can't install far better and improved miui system launcher because of Poco launcher but mi & other brands also can install Poco launcher too. Isn't it unfair to Poco users?
9. Poco users also can't install third-party launchers because full-screen navigation gestures don't support by Poco launcher or miui 12/12.5.
10. App Suggestions are useless, not accurate like miui system launcher and other brands.
11. Floating window doesn't properly work in Poco launcher. It creates many issues sometimes.
12. Poor updates and improvements, Poco launcher rarely gets any new update. Even whenever it get any new updates. Its changelog always mentions "1. We fixed some bugs in this version, 2. Optimize performance and improve the fluency". But we can't see or feel any improvements or bugs fixes. New features forget about it.

I've been using dis phone about two weeks and here's my review-

First of all,

(Camera 2/5-) honestly, camera doesn't matter for me coz I don't take picture a lot but for d viewers I will write some..for me photo should be sharp n clear even when we zoom in.. But dis phone give u over saturated photo n over filtered image.. Bdw girls might impress with it but for me it's not d best one.

(Battery 4/5) - some says it's massive battery phone but I say it's not that, I might say it's average backup coz my last phone's battery backup was 4000mah n I didn't found much difference..

( Processor 4/5 ) - people might say it's a beast gaming phone as it has 720g processor, I tried different game..in game like Mobile Legends, Coc, n God of olympus it perform well but when it come to pubg I would say it's bad coz I don't feel that smoothness on game, for pubg player it's not d device for you n if u really wanna feel excitement of pubg u should go for more dan 855 sd processor n atleast 6gb rom phones.. For pug b I wouldn't recommend dis device

Some advantages-

Fingerprint sensor work really good even when ur finger is little bit sweat , touches work good n floating are smooth, battery last long in normal use when it charged at 100% ( but u have to charge 4 or 5 five minutes extra even it's 100% ) n for d pubg player it could last 4 to 5 hours, n yeah 33w fast charger charge more dan u expected

N some disadvantages-

When u play heavy games like pubg it heated up a little bit n at last it became laggy n affecting ur game, it heated up even when u download big files n when ur internet connection unstable, camera is not good as expected as it's take over saturated photos n low sharpness image, n atleast poco should provide screen protector with box..

So , My overall rating would be 3.5 out of 5 as it is average phone some says it's a beast phone but blve me guys it's not it's just average

And lastly, to flipkart - always late delivery , deducting half star for poor delivery service from ur courier partner.

Hope my review help you all, thank you

I think at 11999 flipkart big bonanza sale has brought a great value for money product the poco m2 pro, with its large 5000mah battery coupled with the 33w charger included in the box it can blow your minds up. When comes to its performance it is blazingly fast and one can hardly notice any lag or jitter thanks to the new 8nm based Qualcomm Snapdragon 720g processor by the way made for gamers cannot disappoint you at all after all it can play any game you throw at it.

I bought it in Jan 2021 and writing review after around 4 months of usage. This is a very genuine review as I really felt like people should be informed correctly about the phone rather than they going into frenzy by Youtubers. Below are issues that I have already seen in this phone:
1. The charger keeps connecting-disconnecting when put to charge. The frequency of on-off can vary on percentage of battery charged and sometimes just without any logic. But this is very irritating if you are using the phone while charging. I couldn't yet find reasons behind this fault.
2. The display is bad as compared to even Xiomi/Redmi's other phone standards. I have used Redmi Note 3, 4 and 5 A so I can say Poco M2 Pro has got worst display. You can see previously used applications fade print in background even if you are using some other app. This is not very pronounced but in dark content videos its easily visible. This is a very big let down and gives feeling of really bad quality display.
3. The headphone socket has eventually shown issues 4-5 times as in sometimes when you insert the jack, the phone will remain in earpiece mode and when you will take the jack out, it will go into headphone mode. This is really really pathetic. The workaround is to restart the phone.
4. Camera is lower than average, it struggles to focus on desired objects specially in bright sunlight. It will focus on farther objects well when you are actually clicking pic of something very close.
5. Built is good and is strong even when backside is of glass (though I have kept cover). However the weight of phone is really too high. It will pain your hands for sure.
6. The placement of headphone jack is really mindless. Its in lower left part of phone which causes hindrance to put the phone and do video calls or simply watch something while headphones on.

Overall: I bought this phone in Rs. 10999 during offer and was actually ready to accept a few defects given it is a feature rich phone. However the defects now I see are so many that even 10999 seems higher to me. Poco has degraded the quality by MIUI 12 further. There are bugs, glitches, hanging issues and poor RAM management. I have not hated any of my previous phones as I hate Poco M2 Pro.

I used an exchange offer. My old phone is in well condition. It has no problem. In left side it has a tiny crack, just like a line. But it is mentioned in flipcart that if your old phone have cracks, damaged etc, then flipcart may reduce your exchangeable product value. I told the courier boy many times, showed him the exchangeable product reject/product value reduction conditions which are mentioned in flipcart. But he said that their courier company, Ekart gave him the order not to take any phone if it has any small line like crack! And he finally refused to take my old phone and said many times to cancel my order. Later I have to take my order by providing full price. My experience with flipcart is highly demotivating!

After using 8 months.

Pros:
1. Fast CPU, it can handle most of the games at medium-high settings without lag.
2. Charging is really fast with 33W charger, on standby it will take around 1:30 hours to finish charging from 0 to 100.
3. Battery life is good, it will stay alive for 6-7 hours on medium load. If you play heavy online games then around 4 hours.
4. Camera is good if you don't look at number of cameras and its megapixels.

Cons:
1. MIUI is really poor in terms of features, it has many bloatware apps that you cannot uninstall.
2. Camera, it's 48MP is just for marketing purposes.
3. If you use earphones the they will have some weird treble and base configuration.
4. With Vi (Vodafone Idea) SIM the network is really poor. It's good in other phones (tested on Realme).

Note:
I gave it 5 stars for its price and performance ratio.
Buy if you don't care about MIUI bugs and camera quality.

Writing this review after 6 months of usage.
Performance is not as good as expected from Snapdragon 720G processor because of very poor optimization from poco company.
Look of the phone is excellent.
Battery is superb and will easily last for 1-2 days depending on the usage. If you are light user, it will last for about 3 days sometimes.
Camera is awesome in this range of phones.
Poco phones come with miui os which has currently becomes one of the worst because of its slow updates, bugs and lags.
App opening animations are also laggy,app crashes many times and there are unusual reboots during calls.
Camera performance of ok but u get saturated photos, but u can use gcam on this phone without root/unlocking bootloader. Gcam and the inbuilt camera quality are almost same, its just that gcam balances the saturation properly.
The phones fingerprint sensor is also not working after 6 months.
Also, we can see that poco and mi phones are having large problems with their ota updates these days. Overall I don't recommend this phone for long term usage.
You can go for realme 8, which is of the same cost(it has a good software, amoled display and indisplay fingerprint scanner which will last longer)(realme gives slow updates but they are very stable)
Mi (parent campany of poco, poco depends on it for almost everything) has released lots of phones recently and making their os stable in such a situation for all phones will be a big burden for them. So better skip them because software is as important as hardware. Also mi has assured only one major update for poco m2 pro (the phone comes with Android 11)
If you want a phone for 4-5 years, better go for oppo phones from 15-20k during the sales. And pls don't misinterpret this.I have said you to buy oppo phones in the range of 15-20k during sales. Buying oppo phones worth lesser than 15k will be your worst experience.
While buying phones pls keep in mind, both hardware and software. If you want software updates for longer time, it's currently being provided my OnePlus and recent Samsung phones only.

I got this mobile in 11000 rupees and i think it's a great deal.
So start with the

Design - i purchased black colour and it's look super classy. But weight of the phone is little bit more as i recently used realme 3 pro which is very lightweight and compact size. You won't use this phone in one hand because it has massive 6.67 inch display. So consider this factor before buying this...

Display - it's awesome and the brightness is quite good in sun light. No issue with this excellent quality for this price point. It has only 60 hz refresh rate but i don't feel it's bad thing. It feels smooth you won't believe but when you use this device you will know it.

Camera - it has 48 mp quad camera but poco should have gone with the sony sensor because even note 7 pro has that sensor. But samsung one is also a good sensor and doing pretty well in day light but in night it's average
And front camera is good but it makes skin reddish. I prefer any other brands for selfie over any Xiaomi phone.

Performance - i personally like Snapdragon processor i recently used realme 3 pro which has 710 and it has 720g. I don't find so much difference. It's a decent processor for day to day use i don't feel any lag till now.

Ui - i personally like custom skin because I love customisation. And miui got some great features. And thanks to poco as it has no ads and i don't find any adds till now (using this for 5 days). But ram management is poor. Poco should consider this issue.

Haptic's - OMG i never used keyboard with vibrations on. But since i have started using it with this device i love how haptic's are respond. I heard in youtube review's poco has provided z shock vibrations. And really it's a great vibration motor. Other brands should provide decent vibration motor also.

Battery - in battery department it's a hit and miss till now. I expected better with this but it's good i got 9 hour battery backup in moderate use. So it's not bad. May be miui optimization is not as good as OnePlus or samsung. Poco has provided 33 watt charger in the box and it charges 0 to 50 percent and 0 to 100 percent in 1 hour 10 to 15 minutes. So for me it's a excellent charging speed.

In short go for it if you are not a camera lover. Specially for selfie lover i suggest realme smartphone. Except camera it's a great device.
